image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Young man's death goes unnoticed for 30 hours in China internet cafe
item.description: A man was found dead at an internet cafe after staff mistook him for sleeping. He passed away during a gaming session, unnoticed for 30 hours. Concerns were raised over lack of monitoring, and local police are investigating. The incident highlights fears over sudden deaths in China.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US Supreme Court rejects teen sex abuse victim's bid to revive Snapchat lawsuit
What is the new OSHA rule? Biden proposes heat protection regulations as US swelters
item.description: The proposed OSHA heat rules, supported by President Joe Biden, aim to safeguard workers from extreme temperatures. California faces wildfires and record heat, with health experts stressing the importance of heat stroke awareness. The proposal faces potential opposition from businesses and trade groups, highlighting the ongoing challenges posed by climate change.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ram Mandir replica to debut at New York's India Day parade
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Beryl kills seven as it churns towards Jamaica
item.description: Hurricane Beryl churned towards Jamaica Tuesday, with forecasters warning of potentially deadly winds and storm surge, after the storm killed at least seven people and caused widespread destruction across the southeastern Caribbean. As of 2300 GMT, Beryl had maximum sustained winds of 150 miles (240 kilometers) per hour as it headed towards Jamaica and the Cayman Islands on Tuesday, according to the NHC. A hurricane watch and tropical storm warnings have also been issued for parts of Haiti.

item.title: Astronaut who clicked iconic 'Earthrise' photo died while doing Flyby
item.description: According to the NTSB report, Anders had informed his friend via text message about his intention to conduct a flyby near her residence on the western shore of Orcas Island. The friend stated that such flybys were not uncommon for Anders, who typically performed two passes and occasionally rocked the airplane's wings but "he never performed any kind of aerobatic maneuvers.‚Äù
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese firms eye Morocco as way to cash in on US electric vehicle subsidies
Rage, sadness, frustration: Turmoil in the White House over Joe Biden
item.description: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday acknowledged his performance during last Thursday's presidential debate wasn't his best, but blamed it on jet lag after two overseas trips earlier in June. Biden has faced mounting questions about his 2024 reelection bid after last week's shaky debate performance, with one House of Representatives fellow Democrat on Tuesday publicly calling on him to withdraw from the race. Speaking at a campaign event in McLean, Virginia, on Tuesday evening, Biden admitted the debate against former President Donald Trump, his Republican rival, did not go well.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China seizes Taiwanese fishing boat, warns Taiwan not to interfere
item.description: Tensions rise as Chinese maritime enforcement persists near Kinmen following the deaths of two Chinese fishermen. President Lai Ching-te's term sees increased pressure from China, prompting Taiwan to seek communication for detained fishermen's release.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Beryl claims 5 lives, weakens to category 4 but remains 'extremely dangerous'

item.title: Debate with Trump: Biden reveals why he 'nearly fell asleep on stage'

item.title: Hurricane Beryl, churning toward Jamaica, threatens Haiti and Dominican Republic
item.description: Hurricane Beryl, a Category 4 storm, poses a threat to Jamaica, Hispaniola, Haiti's Port-au-Prince, and the Cayman Islands. Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves reports severe damage on Union Island. Prime Minister Dickon Mitchell emphasizes the destruction on Carriacou and Petite Martinique. Scientist Christopher Rozoff attributes Beryl's rapid intensification to high North Atlantic temperatures.

item.title: Boris Johnson makes surprise late move to avert Tory wipeout
item.description: Boris Johnson made a surprise appearance on Tuesday night to urge Conservative voters to prevent Labour from achieving a landslide victory in the upcoming UK general election. In an unscheduled speech in central London, Johnson, who is not running as a Tory candidate, warned that a Labour government with a significant majority would undo Conservative achievements.

item.title: China is building and testing lethal attack drones for Russia
item.description: Chinese and Russian companies are reportedly developing an attack drone similar to Iran's Shahed model, which has been used in Ukraine, according to European officials. This collaboration began in 2023 and has progressed to development and testing stages, with the intention of shipping the drones to Russia. The Chinese drones have not yet been deployed in Ukraine.

item.title: Russia's Novorossiysk authorities limit beach access after sea drones attacks
item.description: Russia has often accused Ukraine of attacking its port cities on the Black Sea coast and on the Moscow-annexed Crimean Peninsula, but Russian officials often do not disclose the full extent of damage inflicted by Ukrainian attacks.

item.title: Malaysia court dismisses jailed ex-PM Najib's bid to serve sentence under house arrest
item.description: Former PM Najib Razak's bid for house arrest denied by Malaysian court, pushing for execution of royal order in 1MDB scandal case.

item.title: Haiti PM vows 'transparency' to population traumatized by gangs
item.description: Garry Conille returns as Haiti's prime minister, pledging transparency and cooperation amid gang violence and infrastructural collapse. With a UN background, he focuses on immediate security with international support while reinforcing local police. Conille aims to rebuild trust, address crises, and organize elections by 2026, emphasizing transparency and structured progress for a successful transition.

item.title: Plans to demolish Texas church draw visitors back to sanctuary
